intro: Calyptranthes woodburyi, commonly known as the Woodbury's calyptranthes, is a small evergreen shrub native to the tropical rainforests of Central America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes other plants like eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves that are glossy and dark green. It produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by edible, round berries. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
